title: Vice President and Client Partner
text: Pros I've been with Genpact for 10+ years as part of the sales team. The same characteristics that brought me to Genpact are the same characteristics that I observe every day. The front end team has a great deal of flexibility and authority to work with clients and our delivery teams to shape solutions, both operationally and commercially. The organization can move with great speed, which I hear from clients is a differentiator compared to others in our industry. Our colleagues are talented and work here because they want to make a difference for our clients. I'm a big fan of Genpact as an employee Cons As we have a global delivery model, some new employees take longer than others to get accustomed to working with colleagues from all over the globe. Once you become familiar with working with the diverse team and the work hours to accommodate various time zones, it becomes a normal day in the life, so to speak. Advice to Management stay the course...

title: Good Place to Grow and Go
text: Pros My immediate supervisor and team were very collaborative and helpful in assisting with the learning of new skills and the sharing of ideas. I had the opportunity to gain many job skills that I may not have otherwise been exposed to. Also, we were permitted to work remotely which was huge plus! Good work/life balance. Cons Overseas team was challenging to collaborate with and it seemed as though upper management always favored them even though their talents were not up to par with the US based team. Raises and bonus structure was meager as was opportunities for advancement (promotion). Advice to Management Listen to the needs of your employees when it comes to implementing and maintaining processes. Cutting costs in the short run by removing actual talent and replacing (or transitioning to sub-par talent) is going to be harmful in the long run. Also, promote from within and stop the restructuring. You have talent all around you. Stop overlooking it for the quick, cheap and easy way.

title: Innovation, energy, passion for doing the right things for clients and employees
text: Pros Top leadership team is phenomenal. They are tireless and driven. Each and every one has rolled up their sleeves and done nearly every job. The credentials, intelligence and skill are in tune with the new economy. These people motivate by example. Cons Entrepreneurial and fast moving environment requires 24/7/365 commitment. If you are not motivated and don’t love what you do, it is the wrong place. Forget structure and don’t look to be told what to do. It is expected that you know and can navigate. Advice to Management This next phase of transformation cannot be accomplished by the middle management or next level down from you. They are good at their jobs but don’t have your worldly experience and leadership ability. It will have to be done, like everything else, by you. Sorry.

title: Assistant Vice President, Relationship Management
text: Pros Rarely does one come across an organization that places highest emphasis in up-skilling their employees as much as Genpact. It provides freedom to bring new ideas to the fore and encourages persistence to meet success. If you are curious to learn and centered to think about your customers first, Genpact is the place to build your career. It certainly is an organization taking great strides towards where the future of business solutions lies and is poised for growth. Great senior management too! Cons Working around different time-zones can be draining, however once it becomes a part of the routine, it comes easy. Since Genpact is an organization which was initially heavily operations focused, it can be tough to get away from the broader inclination to be extremely tactical. However, persistence pays and is appreciated. Advice to Management Stay focused, reward talent and innovation, have growth agents work as lean start-ups within the larger ecosystem.

title: CONTENT REVIEW ANALYST
text: Pros You get a pay check...if you are lucky Cons Management lies to everyone all of the time. If they are talking they are lying. Nothing they've told us has come to fruition. They are lying to their client as well. Promotions are based on bogus numbers their software is not reporting correctly. Everyone knows and the animosity towards management for not addressing the issue hangs in the air like a suffocating poisonous cloud. There have been fist fights and one all out brawl. People sit in the parking lot having sex and smoking pot. They are hiring hundreds of people at their Richardson location and can't even implement a functioning time tracking system. They are using managers to manually track the time of hundreds of employees. Many did not receive paychecks for up to 6 weeks. To date people are still having trouble being shorted on their checks. We watch horrible things on video and are supposed to have Wellness Managers on the floor to assist us through trauma. However, they are only available by appointment 3 days a week for 4 hours a day. What about 2nd and 3rd shifts? What happens if someone has a break down? We have no access to phones or the internet. The schools can't reach you if there is an emergency. You couldn't possibly reach the police if needed and security is at a remote location at the entry way. They wouldn't hear anything if something happened. People are being packed in like sardines. Management talks big but does the exact opposite. This is the most soul destroying place I've ever worked and it could easily be so much better. Once their client finds out how they've been duped its going to fall apart. Advice to Management Bring in Americans who aren't stuck in the caste system.

title: Worst Company I've Ever Seen... Seriously RUN!
text: Pros Bi-weekly pay, good benefits. But there are no amount of pros to compensate for how terrible a place Genpact is to work. Cons This is the most unorganized, chaotic and demoralizing company I've ever been exposed to. "Home grown" leadership team is inexperienced in their supposed areas of expertise. Indian dominant culture is harsh, rude and inefficient. Lying to employees is a common practice and the general mode of operation. There are so many non-ethical and HR (labor laws) violations it's ridiculous that this company hasn't been taken down. Hiring practices are illegal (they try to screen out certain races by researching candidates online before setting up interviews and they get away with it by calling it "hiring for diversity"). If you are considering working at Genpact, consider EVERY other option you have first, because 60% of what you are told during the interview/hiring process is a lie. If you have to take a job at Genpact try to get out as fast as possible. I read some of the company reviews on Glassdoor when I was considering taking a position at Genpact and I didn't give enough weight to what US based employees said. Reviews from employees in India could make you think that it's a good company with some disgruntled US employees. I can't speak for other US locations, but the Richardson, TX office is a horrible place to work and a large number of employees there are miserable, and it's because if the leadership team and the way employees are treated. Their systems and processes are so inefficient and backwards that it's not uncommon for employees to not get paid for time worked. Think hard before taking any position at Genpact. Advice to Management Be better people. Learn how to really do your jobs. Do the right thing for your clients and employees. Start treating employees with respect and stop the lies.

cons: This is the most unorganized, chaotic and demoralizing company I've ever been exposed to. "Home grown" leadership team is inexperienced in their supposed areas of expertise. Their systems and processes are so inefficient and backwards that it's not uncommon for employees to not get paid for time worked. Think hard before taking any position at Genpact.

title: Fake Managers
text: Pros Training in Google Marketing products, including AdWords and Google My Business. Cons The Farmington Hills, MI location has no long-term or short-term operations plans. The only plan is day-to-day chaotic movement of phone staff employees. There’s never a real explanation for the move. Management and Team Lead will lie to you and put no effort into sounding believable. Management has no respect for phone staff and expect you to just be flexible. Management and Team Leads only concerns are the daily metrics. The metrics seem impossible to reach and not sure if they are real. Blame the other Guy is the name of the game here. The hourly pay is on the bottom of industry average. Monthly bonus (if you ever get one) is not enough to have a great meal out. Do not believe anything that you are told in the interview. title: Terrible Company to work for!
text: Pros There are no pros to working for this horrible company Cons Sweatshop type of company: Overworked, very little training, no help from management, harsh reprimands from rude managers, backstabbing by brown nosing longer term employees. Advice to Management The CEO of this company is from India. The company is not run as an American style company, but run as if it were based in India. Tremendous impossible workload with very low pay. Not only that, but there was no help available to learn the new systems which were constantly changing. It was so bad in my department; When I arrived there were about 10 employees in my department. Within less than 3 months, 6 of those employees were already gone! I left too after 3 months. A 70 percent turnover within three months! The CEO needs to treat employees by American standards, not run it like we are in India (a third world country.) There was a tremendous amount of backstabbing in our department as well. I was even told by my trainer that "if you have another job you can pursue, run as fast as you can. Its a terrible company to work for." This was told to me by my trainer on my second day there! She left a month after I arrived. It truly was run like a sweatshop and I am glad I don't work there anymore.

title: Old boys club with high turnover rate
text: Pros High turnover rate lends opportunity to change roles. Cons It's an old boys club with a group of Indian men who invent new management positions to bring their buddies over to live in the US. In US conference rooms, they will switch to non-English to exclude team members from participating in discussions. It creates a very hostile environment, especially in the NYC office. -Shady RFP responses, if clients were to dig deeper, they would find dishonesty ripe throughout the organization -Claim to promote women in their workforce but only make meaningful changes in Indian operations. The same old boy's club that has full control of upper management has not adapted to US professional environments, meaning they do not embrace gender equality or diversity, despite an abundance of hashtags and LinkedIn articles about it -Openly discriminate against pregnant women. In my time here, I've seen 3 expecting mothers pushed out with management openly discussing why pregnancy is bad. As a father myself, this is disgusting.  -Constant reassignment in the sales coverage, hire people for one job, switch it 6 months later. Advice to Management Hire an outside consultant to dig deep into why your turnover rate for AVPs and VPs is so high.

title: Flexible Lifestyle but Low Pay
text: Pros Working for Genpact Solutions Inc. in Cincinnati, OH is as close to being and independent contractor as you can get without having your own LLC. To be successful at this company you have to manage your own time and priorities wisely. As long as you keep the customer (GE) happy, Genpact is happy. A healthy work life balance is very achievable here. Vacation benefits are above avg at 3 weeks / year. Health & Dental insurance are just OK. After proving my capabilities for the first year, Genpact and I came to an agreement that allowed me to stay full time at 32 hours / week, while attending night school to finish my Bachelors Degree. This took 2.5 years to complete. I'm very grateful to Genpact for supporting this endeavor. Management has always had my back in times of conflict or uncertainty with other co-workers and/or tough market conditions (lay-offs, etc.). They are also supportive in my life goals outside of work. Cons Low Pay. Genpact does not understand market value of an experienced engineer and/or industry standards in regards to salary. I am $15k-$25k below a competitive industry standard salary for the type of work I do, experience, and skill set. Part of this is likely my fault for not fully understanding my own worth when I signed on with Genpact 4 years ago. I have not had a single raise in those 4 years although I have been asking for over 2 years. I have been identified as a "top performer" in every performance review, have earned 2 achievement awards over the years, and have many written emails from the customer expressing accolades for my work. So, my lack of raise is NOT because I am underperforming. Having lots of freedom and independence is great, as mentioned in the Pros section. But keep in mind this also means that management is somewhat disconnected from what you do. They, along with HR, can sometimes be slow to respond to inquiries and requests - especially if it has anything to do with money. Advice to Management Pay your top performers what they're worth. If not, it puts us in a very tough position and will likely force us to seek an employer who will.

title: Soul-Crushing
text: Pros The pay was decent, but not enough to make up for the hair-tearing frustration, the constant shortsighted policy-changes, or the toxic office-culture. Cons Genpact is famous in its industry for being close-lipped and miserly with information, especially where layoffs, firings, and unpopular changes in policy are concerned. To them, workers are meant to be exploited until they break, and then to be replaced as quickly as possible. Evaluations are metrics-based, but the criteria change so often that you will never be able to guess in advance what you'll be evaluated on this month (but you *can* expect that every "mistake" you make will come directly out of your paycheck). Management is profoundly uninterested in receiving feedback from any of its employees, especially those who actually interact with customers. Middle management constantly changes company policies in an attempt to prove to upper management that something, anything, is being done, but none of these policies' long-term effects are ever taken into account before implementation. Fortunately, reversals are so frequent that you'll never have the chance to get used to a policy before it's replaced with something even more asinine. Veteran employees view new hires with a mixture of pity and contempt: these poor saps have no idea what they've signed up for, or how difficult it will be to find a decent job with the stain of Genpact tainting their resumes. They generally advise new hires to leave as quickly as possible, before the hopelessness infects them too. In fact, that's what I'm doing right now: get out while you still can. Advice to Management If they wouldn't listen to us when we worked for them, they sure as heck won't listen to us now.

title: Ad Writer
text: Pros Great atmosphere and fun work assignments. Cons We were hired through a temp agency, but Genpact decided to end our assignment abruptly without warning or a sensible explanation. In fact, they called us after hours to let us know our assignment ended right after we had left the office for the day. Very unprofessional. Also team leads and assignment instructions were unclear and all over the place. Leadership was not there, therefore everything could be extremely disorganized and chaotic at times. Advice to Management Make sure all team leads are on the same page, know what they are talking about, and give out the exact same info. Also take the time to actually train people properly instead of rushing through orientation.
pros: Great atmosphere and fun work assignments.
cons: We were hired through a temp agency, but Genpact decided to end our assignment abruptly without warning or a sensible explanation. In fact, they called us after hours to let us know our assignment ended right after we had left the office for the day. Very unprofessional.

title: Do yourself a favor, pass them up!
text: Pros Work-life Balance was good. Some, SOME of the people I worked with were great, and was able to have a conversation where it didn't seem so generic. Cons I can go in and tell you where ALL the bodies are buried in this company, but I won't. Just trust and believe me when I tell you that this is NOT the company for you. Unless, of course, if you're Indian and someone brings you in. If you're American, they try to pass themselves off as if they're better than you, and talk down to you. Yet, they can't form two tangible sentences that make sense - this coming from one of their own clients - yep, I saw the email! VP'S expect you to be on and accessible at all times of the day and night. After 'The Scandal' that broke earlier this summer, that was my icing on the cake that prompted me to get out, and get out fast! HR is a mess, their on-site IT team is a joke! Like I said, I can go on, and on. This was the worst position I EVER had! Advice to Management Get a grip on yourselves. You are not the 'end all' in this business. When one of your VP'S can't keep an Assistant and goes through 3 of them within a one year span, that actually says a lot about that person. Other EA members shouldn't be placing bets to see how long the next EA would last before she runs screaming into the night - metaphorically speaking.
pros: Work-life Balance was good. Some, SOME of the people I worked with were great, and was able to have a conversation where it didn't seem so generic.
cons: I can go in and tell you where ALL the bodies are buried in this company, but I won't. Just trust and believe me when I tell you that this is NOT the company for you. Unless, of course, if you're Indian and someone brings you in. If you're American, they try to pass themselves off as if they're better than you, and talk down to you. Yet, they can't form two tangible sentences that make sense - this coming from one of their own clients - yep, I saw the email! VP'S expect you to be on and accessible at all times of the day and night. After 'The Scandal' that broke earlier this summer, that was my icing on the cake that prompted me to get out, and get out fast! HR is a mess, their on-site IT team is a joke! Like I said, I can go on, and on. This was the worst position I EVER had!
advice: Get a grip on yourselves. You are not the 'end all' in this business. When one of your VP'S can't keep an Assistant and goes through 3 of them within a one year span, that actually says a lot about that person. Other EA members shouldn't be placing bets to see how long the next EA would last before she runs screaming into the night - metaphorically speaking.

title: Account Strategist - Sales Team
text: Pros Great training, benefits, management and staff! I have worked here for six months, and I have already changed processes. It is possible to move between processes! On the sales team there is great flexibility and high earning potential. I made high commission after only two months. The management team treat employees with respect and make time for any questions. There is some flexibility to the hours, but not on days worked. It is a genuinely valuable process to learn. There are great opportunities to boost your resume and to learn. Cons Because of the demands of the client, sometimes poor candidates are hired to meet quotas. This has less of an affect on the Sales team, but can be a distraction and a little demoralizing. As a vendor we sign a confidentiality agreement that does not allow us to tell prospective employers what we do. Advice to Management Do not allow people who do not excel in training to reach the floor! Other than that, I am very satisfied with the way that I have been treated. I feel respected, valued and fulfilled (for now).
pros: Great training, benefits, management and staff! I have worked here for six months, and I have already changed processes. It is possible to move between processes!
cons: Because of the demands of the client, sometimes poor candidates are hired to meet quotas. This has less of an affect on the Sales team, but can be a distraction and a little demoralizing.
advice: Do not allow people who do not excel in training to reach the floor!

title: The worst treatment I've ever experienced in my 25 year career
text: Pros Attracted me with generous sign on bonus and competitive salary. All down hill from there. Cons Where should start? - RFP responses are not aligned to business strategy. Committee (QSRM) that approves new business accepts almost all new business. The entire committee is made up of Sales Leaders, so what would one expect? - I was treated with extreme disrespect by leadership. By disrespect, I mean public embarrassment on multiple occasions even after I politely requested a change in this behavior. I reported this to HR. As far as I know, no action was taken - Hierarchical policies- for example, only VPs travel business class. AVPs and lower travel economy no matter how long the flight is. Ever travel US to India in coach? Not recommended. - Very annoying and inefficient internal processes due to excessive controls. For example, when you book travel your manager needs to approve it in the system. The approval window can be very short, and travel is automatically cancelled if the approval window is missed. Just imagine the frustration of having to resubmit the whole thing and wondering if the window will be missed again. Too many more cons to mention. My best advice is to not get lured into this awful place to begin with. Advice to Management Genpact is too far gone for a quick fix. Advice to Bain Capital: you need to broadly clean house at the CXO +1 level, maybe +2 in some cases.
pros: Attracted me with generous sign on bonus and competitive salary. All down hill from there.
cons: Where should start?
advice: Genpact is too far gone for a quick fix. Advice to Bain Capital: you need to broadly clean house at the CXO +1 level, maybe +2 in some cases.

title: Good coworkers, clueless management.
text: Pros Casual environment. Good coworkers. Try to make it a fun place to work. Cons Employee performance is based mainly on feedback surveys. Even if someone hits you because they are unhappy about a policy or procedure you have no control over, you are punished for it. You provide support products that there is little or no training provided for. You are expected to "find the answer" with the customer while on the phone. You can't even take your training materials home during training to study so you are expected to remember everything and start fresh each day. You are subject to policies from the contractor you support but have no idea what the policies are because no one outside of the contractor company has access to them. If there is an issue, the contractor is right and you are wrong. If you violate a policy, you are fired without any warning. They will just hire someone to replace you. They are constantly hiring. Advice to Management Provide better training, Be clear on your contractor's policies and how they affect YOUR employees.

title: Genpact
text: Pros If you get the opportunity they train you in Lean/Six Sigma Good visibility to clients - depending on your role and you learn new things. Atleast in my role - excellent pay Cons neurotic leadership who do not know who to run a large company and compete with the best of the best. Want proof - look at their stock basically flat over 2 years. So much for Bain making a killing on their investment! Would definitely improve morale if leadership was shuffled and new blood brought in. Current fools in the C-suite don't know anything about leadership. CEO writes white papers on the war for talent -hypocrisy? Advice to Management Grow up - you cannot run a company where everything has to go through the SVP/EVP/CEO on bids. Give your VP/AVP teams authority to make decisions and then hold them accountable. I learnt quickly that when you win a deal everyone gets credit - when you lose a deal they start looking for scape goats! Think about it - your stock has gone no where in 5 years a paltry ~5.5% return per year...S&P would have been a better investment for Bain. ....isn't that the best gauge of how well your leadership team is performing? Everyone one of your leaders (except the recent CFO hire) has been there since the beginning - time for new blood in the C-suites..
pros: If you get the opportunity they train you in Lean/Six Sigma
cons: neurotic leadership who do not know who to run a large company and compete with the best of the best. Want proof - look at their stock basically flat over 2 years. So much for Bain making a killing on their investment!
advice: Grow up - you cannot run a company where everything has to go through the SVP/EVP/CEO on bids. Give your VP/AVP teams authority to make decisions and then hold them accountable. I learnt quickly that when you win a deal everyone gets credit - when you lose a deal they start looking for scape goats!

This is a good place to build a resume from start in advertising/marketing Cons The hours can be a little rough with every other month being 11:30 to 8. title: Disorganized Chaos
text: Pros -Some nice people to work with -Still developing in the mortgage space, so someone smart ,with drive, can go far. However they may have to put up with a lot of pressure before anything good may come. Cons Genpact as an established company may have many good processes in place and good goals, however the execution in the mortgage space, for this branch, is below par. -Key complaint is management and their lack of understanding of job duties of processors and their inability to motivate. Advice to Management Be honest with employees about the business needs and where we need to take the company to meet obligations to client and other. Avoid demeaning employees and their job performance and instead try to find out why there is a disconnect with SLA and actual achievement among the vast majority of processors. New processor hires will not fix the system without management support. And right now, that support is not there.
pros: -Some nice people to work with
cons: Genpact as an established company may have many good processes in place and good goals, however the execution in the mortgage space, for this branch, is below par.
advice: Be honest with employees about the business needs and where we need to take the company to meet obligations to client and other. title: Hopeful but disappointing
text: Pros Great Working hours, sick pay and technology. There are some very nice and helpful people who want to do their job and train others so that everyone’s lives are easier and more fulfilling. Someone has a vision to make the company more efficient but there are a lot of staff with power who sabotage it. Cons Cliquey and Aggressive management skills. I was doubted when I for the reason I was seeking help. The lead up to my departure was not comfortable. Too much pressure can be put onto one person (noticed it in other teams). When things aren’t done you’re told to ask for help, when you ask for help you’re told you have to just do it yourself. Advice to Management Communicate with your staff more. Don’t push back 1-2-1 meetings. Ensure the safety of your staff at all times. Don’t allow bullying to have its place in your work environment.

title: Good company but no transport and cost cutting in cafeteria.
text: Pros The company is good I recently joined and got a nice hike in salary. Great place to learning and chances are more to go on-site. Cons The transport facility is pinning me only , the pick facility is not available and drop facility is chargeable. Which I think should not be there. Advice to Management The company is no doubt very good and have a nice repo in market , but as I've joined Genpact , the cafeteria doesn't have coffee mugs and water glasses. If you are thirsty , you need to carry your glass or bottle which I think is very bad. Water is a basic thing and cost cutting should not be applied on this. Another thing is that transport facility should be both side and not chargeable , like every other company. A great organisation comes with happiest people and people will be more happier and would love to work if they'd get the basic services , which is transport and cafeteria stuff. :) However I'm proud to be a part of Genpact family.
pros: The company is good I recently joined and got a nice hike in salary.
cons: The transport facility is pinning me only , the pick facility is not available and drop facility is chargeable.

title: Subject Matter Expert Record to Report
text: Pros Genpact is about 5-7 years ahead of any other company related to controls/operating systems and control frameworks, Also, one big advantage is that you as person get a huge advantage by working with different team of diverse cultural background, this create a mindset of being more tolerant and enrich you as person. Projects are never the same, they are changing with the speed of new technologies, if you are keen do explore the ambiguity and learning on the go, this is the company you are looking for. Manager are very knowledgeable, and they share their insights without hesitation, this is based in my experience, I always said, you talk about the party depending on the experience you had. =) You learn about more innovative trends in management, learning, and technology, of course this is not that you will stop your day to day activities to learn. Integrity is always observed, and this creates a safe environment for any complaint you may have with upper management, meant to say that retaliation is not something they exercise. Last for not least flexibility is a great feature, because it allows you to create a work balance, of course, you can take all morning to do any personal stuff, but you will need to be present when required, this is more like two-way streets, half and half. Otherwise it will be abusive at both ends Cons Genpact is not the best salary company, however training and talent development compensate, Cultural thing is an awesome experience, however that is also time to time a big roadblock when working with people from different poles, where business status time to time is more important than common sense. Advice to Management Training programs related to new technologies should be open for all people not for those only with a valid USA working permit, if requirement is to have a USA visa work permit, I believe that within HHRR you will know who that people are, then distribute communication only to them, otherwise expectations are set and at the time of the Q&A on the kickoff programs there is lots of waste of time and people is disappointed because not clear communication on the email teasers.
pros: Genpact is about 5-7 years ahead of any other company related to controls/operating systems and control frameworks,
cons: Genpact is not the best salary company, however training and talent development compensate,
advice: Training programs related to new technologies should be open for all people not for those only with a valid USA working permit, if requirement is to have a USA visa work permit, I believe that within HHRR you will know who that people are, then distribute communication only to them, otherwise expectations are set and at the time of the Q&A on the kickoff programs there is lots of waste of time and people is disappointed because not clear communication on the email teasers.

title: Throwing foreigners out of house, forces to sign documents, revoking job offer
text: Pros They arranged the flight towards Bucharest Cons Company without any ethics to foreigners They promised to arrange transport from my location to the company in Romania and free accomodation -Taxi was booked on a wrong time and I only found out during flight and had to arrange this -At the accomodation nobody was there so I called, after half an hour someone showed up -Before I could move into the apartment I had to sign a contract to pay 660 euro which was not told, I refused to sign and I got kicked out in the late evening, had to arrange accomodation myself in a strange country as a foreigner who does not speak the language -Company sent new document requirements and when I obtained the documents they sent me an e-mail they revoked the job offer Advice to Management You work with people and should treat them like that. It's inhuman to put a foreigner, who is new in the country, on the streets in the late evening and later revoking a job offer. Don't make promises you cannot keep and do fair business.
pros: They arranged the flight towards Bucharest
cons: Company without any ethics to foreigners
advice: You work with people and should treat them like that. It's inhuman to put a foreigner, who is new in the country, on the streets in the late evening and later revoking a job offer. Don't make promises you cannot keep and do fair business.

title: Unethical and Disappointing
text: Pros I would have written something here, if there were any pros to add. If Glassdoor gave that option, a negative overall rating is what I'd have gone for. Cons The organization hired me for National Australian Bank (NAB), a pilot process and requested me to join immediately. Their keenness to start the process (induction and training as the team was ready) asap, required me to quit my previous work place without even serving the full notice period. They issued a Letter of Intent (which included CTC, Designation, Work place, Joining Date etc.) stating that I am a part of their workforce and I should resign from my previous job. Inspite of my hesitancy to take such a step without an Offer Letter in hand, I succumbed as it was a good opportunity, great process and reasonable pay hike. Also the major details regarding my work there were shared with me officially in my Letter of Intent and they also made me talk to my manager to give me assurances. But as soon as the date of joining approached and I got in touch with them, they started delaying the date. They kept telling me that I would receive an official mail and call from them the next day. And this "next day" happened for over a week. Later, I get a call from them stating that the project was scrapped. *They made me quit my previous job assuring me that Genpact process was final- the resignation was necessary so as to make sure I do not indulge in dual employment. *They didn't let me finish the Notice period at my previous workplace as the process at Genpact was solely waiting on my joining to initiate. So I had to pay from my pocket for not finishing up the notice. *They did not start with their induction and training as on the date that they had stated. Thus, making me lose my pay from any workplaces for those days. *And finally, they very simply stated that the project was scrapped and would take me for some customer care department in a different location (which is 2 hours from my place, one way) and at an odd hour shift. As per them, they were doing ,me a favour by not making me re-interview for the new customer care process, which from what I have understood required less skill set. And considering the new job location is not easily commutable distance from my place and that too at odd work hours (3 AM) for a profile I did not sign up for, I seriously fail to see the good that they are offering there. And what's more? Ever since that, they have stopped communicating with me. They do not revert to my mails, messages, phone calls... nothing. They very conveniently put me in a soup and have disappeared. I fail to understand how did they come to be such a big brand if this is the way their HR team functions, the management runs. Or is it all just a facade! I would never want to work with such an organization and recommend nobody to take it up either. What happened with me was at the beginning, yours could be after you join or while leaving. You never know! You can never tell! Not with the kind of things that this organization is capable of pulling off. Advice to Management The organization needs to be more transparent and communicate internally as well. I cannot comprehend how the organization that was so keen to make me join them in a week for the process suddenly decided to strike down the project completely. And moreover, stop playing with people's job and their careers. You can very conveniently say a 'sorry' for messing things up, but they still have to fend for themselves and their families and their lives. And if things get faulty at your part, have the decency to provide a solution and not completely go off the radar. That's just plain brutal and insincere.
pros: I would have written something here, if there were any pros to add. If Glassdoor gave that option, a negative overall rating is what I'd have gone for.
cons: The organization hired me for National Australian Bank (NAB), a pilot process and requested me to join immediately. Their keenness to start the process (induction and training as the team was ready) asap, required me to quit my previous work place without even serving the full notice period. They issued a Letter of Intent (which included CTC, Designation, Work place, Joining Date etc.) stating that I am a part of their workforce and I should resign from my previous job. Inspite of my hesitancy to take such a step without an Offer Letter in hand, I succumbed as it was a good opportunity, great process and reasonable pay hike. Also the major details regarding my work there were shared with me officially in my Letter of Intent and they also made me talk to my manager to give me assurances. But as soon as the date of joining approached and I got in touch with them, they started delaying the date. They kept telling me that I would receive an official mail and call from them the next day. And this "next day" happened for over a week. Later, I get a call from them stating that the project was scrapped.
advice: The organization needs to be more transparent and communicate internally as well. I cannot comprehend how the organization that was so keen to make me join them in a week for the process suddenly decided to strike down the project completely.

Hiring quality is as bad as you'll never expect in any corporate culture. Advice to Management Consider promoting quality people to next level, but not those who work like robots. Because of quality less managers and poor management and because of no employee centricity, people often leave company soon. Look at the quality of managers working for Google client. Other companies are growing with multiple pods from the same client, while Genpact is loosing the existing business

title: One of the right places to start your career
text: Pros People friendly place, work from home and shift flexibility based on the account you're working on, variable pay based on your account and band, strong emphasis on quality management and certification, encourage new skills and trainings for career growth, their massive efforts and support towards corporate social responsibility. Cons Very poor increment, bias from management or HR based on the account you're in, their focus on cost cutting in every aspect, restriction on company sponsored team outings. Advice to Management It would be great if what they invest in mergers and acquisitions could be done on the existing employees, especially with monetary benefits, which will encourage them to be more productive and reduce attrition as well. Also on certain employee friendly facilities like more variety of food in cafeteria, food allowance or lesser cost on food, gym or other options like it, more emphasis on zero hour. Also please support the right leaders who are supportive to their employees than the ones who are a pain to their employees.
pros: People friendly place, work from home and shift flexibility based on the account you're working on, variable pay based on your account and band, strong emphasis on quality management and certification, encourage new skills and trainings for career growth, their massive efforts and support towards corporate social responsibility.
cons: Very poor increment, bias from management or HR based on the account you're in, their focus on cost cutting in every aspect, restriction on company sponsored team outings.
advice: It would be great if what they invest in mergers and acquisitions could be done on the existing employees, especially with monetary benefits, which will encourage them to be more productive and reduce attrition as well. Also on certain employee friendly facilities like more variety of food in cafeteria, food allowance or lesser cost on food, gym or other options like it, more emphasis on zero hour. Also please support the right leaders who are supportive to their employees than the ones who are a pain to their employees.

title: Far from the best
text: Pros - Exposure to some exciting projects.  - Working from home - although that is also a negative as you will find that there is very little 'team' ethos at this company.  - Part of an international network. Although, many things are controlled in the US and India, which means that you are paralysed until they make a decision. Cons - Very disorganised.  - There is little team ethos. Each man is working for himself on his own project.  - When I was there, you could never get a seat in the London office. Reception would email at 9am to tell people to work from home if they can.  - You could never book an office. Either they are booked up weeks in advance or people are using them because they cannot find a seat.  - No clear strategy as to how to move forward.  - Although they sell 'working from home' in reality it means that you are expected to be working all of the time. It was the 4am email message that put a meeting in my diary for 8am that same day that was the final straw for me.  - Pay is not very good and benefits are practically non-existent. Basic auto-enrolment pension for a professional services firm is a joke. Advice to Management Build a team ethos amongst your London staff. If everyone is striving for the same goal you will have a happier and more profitable business.
pros: - Exposure to some exciting projects.
cons: - Very disorganised.
advice: Build a team ethos amongst your London staff. If everyone is striving for the same goal you will have a happier and more profitable business.

title: Brilliant positioning on the market, reality not that great!
text: Pros Employees are encouraged to learn more, be curious, form multi-disciplinary teams and take different roles from time to time Cons Fancy titles for common jobs, which in reality are much less interesting than promised/advertised; transactional, not judgmental tasks are presented as very cool roles; a lot of people with no real technical competences are promoted merely based on their good relationships with VPs; Incompetence is sometimes really hard to cope with, incompetent people are more and more every year. Advice to Management Act more like a global, multinational company. In recent years, the influence from India in all on-shore locations and all areas is simply counter-productive and reflects a bad image of the company in Europe and America. Do try to develop more the on-shore locations, instead of just treat them as intermediaries for shipping processes to India.
pros: Employees are encouraged to learn more, be curious, form multi-disciplinary teams and take different roles from time to time
cons: Fancy titles for common jobs, which in reality are much less interesting than promised/advertised; transactional, not judgmental tasks are presented as very cool roles; a lot of people with no real technical competences are promoted merely based on their good relationships with VPs; Incompetence is sometimes really hard to cope with, incompetent people are more and more every year.

title: Interesting with some buts ...
text: Pros The interview procedure was quick. I was hired from Pune to work for Hyderabad location. It was just one round interview. Only because I was hired from a different state altogether so the interview procedure was quick and smooth but if I was a candidate from the same location there are multiple rounds of interview. The work life balance in Genpact is pretty cool you are only responsible for your own work unless and until you are at a band 4 level but if you can take initiatives and keep yourself under the radar of senior managers aur assistant vice president then it will do good in your career. Also they give you opportunities Tu change one project to another however make sure before changing to different projects what is going to be your revised CTC and if you are still going to get your monthly bonus for band 5 level. If you don't consider yourself as a big achiever and you really don't need a lot of promotions of growth no one is going to bother you with anything. Your job in Genpact is totally secure and you can expect around 8 to 10 percentage of CTC Hike every year at band 5 level and around 6 - 9 percentage hike every year at band 4 level it depends on your performance. Cons The food in cafeteria is mostly garbage. The transportation is not free of cost if you are taking home drops even you work in night shifts. The old HR who are working M Genpact for over 7 8 years are basically from the operations team. They are not in real HR. Naturally they don't have and they had never grown the soft skills I charts should pauses in a MNC environment. They don't even know how to give respect when they are talking with women employee. If you are trying to leave Genpact and somehow the HR team of the operation team gets to know about it then they will make sure that your life is a living hell. Don't take any verbal promises from anyone in Genpact they basically are lies. I have seen people who resigned and serving notice periods and then someone from HR promises percentage Hike or promotion. Based on that the employee don't go to there new companies. But be very sure when it comes to fulfill the promise Genpact HR will turn 180° opposite side. In case if you are willing to do this kind of work then make sure you get your revised offer letter or revised salary hike letter within your notice period otherwise the chances are you will never get it. Advice to Management It was a blunder when Genpact hired 3 assistant managers from Wipro to serve as team leads in Genpact Boeing project. This project started with 70 people and within 24 months nearly 90% of your old employees are gone trust me it is because of these three managers and rest of the Wipro folks came to Genpact. You should have fire this managers way before the resigned themselves you still have time to allocate the remaining Wipro Associates to other projects within Genpact.

title: Worst company in the world - Do not work here!
text: Pros Can't think of any pros Cons So many to share, it's embarrassing. Let me try capturing all (but I am sure I would have missed a few) - 1. Poor Management Team - Management is utterly disorganized. No clue about the business and almost no idea how to deal with people. I have worked both in London and Bangalore and found the situation to be no different 2. Farcical HR institution - The HR institution is merely an extension of the management, clad in the robe of a HR team. They do not provide any answers and in the event of a dispute with management, be assured you will receive no support from the HR. As an example, I had to survive for a few months without pay for no fault of mine and the HR and management did absolutely nothing. 3. Laggard processes - For an organisation claiming black belt expertise, no process is streamlined. Getting something as simple as expenses claimed can take between 30-90 days! Note that expenses get deducted from salary at the end of 90 days. The process of claims from salary is faster than process of expenses being cleared! 4. Lack of interesting opportunities - I was lucky to get one of the few interesting opportunities we had, allowing me to travel, however, majority of the people I've worked with left in frustration. The attrition was as high as 40% because of a lack of career growth. This is clearly a poor reflection on the organisation. 5. Salary structure - Be aware, what you are promised is not what you will get. The structure is in such a manner that you will likely only make 60-70% of what you believed you would get in hand. 6. Benefits - There are absolutely no benefits. Most other organisations offer benefits like cabs, gym discounts, bike rental discounts etc, however, there are no such benefits here. 7. Bonus and Increment - Bonus and increment are laughable. In a year where the company made handsome profits and being rated top performed, I got less than 10% salary hike and less increment than contractually agreed. This was because the division performed poorly (which is a result of poor management than poor work of the employees), clearly the bonus and increment structure is flawed. Advice to Management Please shut down this god awful company and do us all a favor. If you really do want to keep running this organisation, please recognize that people are your biggest assets, restructure the processes top to bottom, change the focus of the HR team to actually help people and finally pay bonuses and increment commensurate to the hard work of the employees.
pros: Can't think of any pros
cons: So many to share, it's embarrassing. Let me try capturing all (but I am sure I would have missed a few) -
advice: Please shut down this god awful company and do us all a favor. If you really do want to keep running this organisation, please recognize that people are your biggest assets, restructure the processes top to bottom, change the focus of the HR team to actually help people and finally pay bonuses and increment commensurate to the hard work of the employees.

title: Great place to start your career, poor of staying for longer than 2 to 3 years
text: Pros Genpact has been known to create market leaders in the field of Analytics for quite some time now. Great place to start your career as a fresher. Lots of things to learn. It's a heaven for women employees as work life balance is excellent. Girls can plan their entire life such as marriage kids etc without having to worry about office. A process and operations excellence driven company. There is a lot of flexibility in terms of work timings for those working in FTE billing type of roles. Genpact is a great company to use as a stepping stone to launch your career into better companies such as the Big 4 consulting firms and other Big shot IT consulting firms. Cons Biggest con is that the salary structure is way below market standards. It is way way below, can't even describe how low it is. DO NOT stay in Genpact for more than 2 to 3 years at a stretch because even with multiple hikes and promotions, your remuneration will be below market standards. Genpact is solely focussing on Financial analytics and is not focussing on other areas of business. Also, most of the work they do is pure reporting type of work, and does not delve much into Advanced Analytics and other latest technologies which are more relevant today. Very little or almost Nil innovation within Genpact, as such employees still end up using the same excel based reports and age old drab tools. If you have an innovative mindset and are well qualified, do not join Genpact as your managers will not have an idea what to do with your talents. Another con which I personally experienced is that although culturally Genpact is quite good, some managers and seniors run the company based in their own whims and fancies with utter disregard to human values or professional ethics. Advice to Management The management at Genpact is very happy and satisfied as they pocket a huge chunk of the benefits. My advice to employees is - Use Genpact's tag as a leverage and launch yourself into higher roles with better companies. DO NOT make the mistake of staying for longer than two to at max three years . All The Best !!

title: They Ruin Careers
text: Pros Good work-life balance, lesser work and more life. Truly practices diversity. You get to manage larger teams at higher levels. Cons Almost every process looks great on the JD. Very frequently you are lied about your profile. Only once you join the company, you realize the truth. Employees ( especially business analysts and AMs) are not respected and treated as cattle. High ..high attrition rate and to discourage that, they have come up with pathetically regressive HR policies. 90 days non negotiable notice period( even if you are on bench). Pathetic work quality. They hire MBAs, CFAs and CAs, but give them copy paste work to do. You are being paid, that is the reason enough for them to spoil your career. It is a company for people with no career aspirations. WARNING!! if you ever receive an offer from Genpact, do everything possible to confirm the kind of work you would actually be doing. NEVER go by the JD and the manager tells you prior joining. Advice to Management Stop lying and deceiving people. You should not trap people into pathetic jobs.

title: Senior Associate
text: Pros Genpact is a good place to learn and develop. The employees are given opportunity to be a part of decision making. Lots of training and you can enroll in any of the available training's in the L&D portal. Great work life balance. Decent job security as compared to other IT firms. Cons 1. The salary is very less almost 20 to 30 percent below the market average 2. You may start your carrier with a salary as less a 10,000 3. The hikes are average 4. The cafeteria is not good, it is congested (Hyd DLF campus) despite many complaints they do not change the catering service provider 5. The work hours are odd in most of the cases and no additional benefits are provided for working on these hours 6. Getting a promotion not only depends on performance but also on relation with your immediate manager and your visibility in the floor 7. Very less onsite opportunity and the existing ones are grabbed by the middle management and the higher management (a person at engineer/ senior engineer hardly goes abroad, Onsite is not rotational, if a mid level person goes onsite he never returns back) 8. The presence of Software in the organization is less, it is still primarily a BPO company. 9. Need approvals and tickets for each and every thing and lots of red tape even for installing a basic software like Notepad++, eclipse, Java etc Advice to Management 1. Increase the salary, Genpact is among the lowest paymasters in the industry 2. Onsite opportunities should be based on talent rather than being a part of middle management 3. Increase the presence of Software
pros: Genpact is a good place to learn and develop. The employees are given opportunity to be a part of decision making. Lots of training and you can enroll in any of the available training's in the L&D portal. Great work life balance. Decent job security as compared to other IT firms.
cons: 1. The salary is very less almost 20 to 30 percent below the market average
advice: 1. Increase the salary, Genpact is among the lowest paymasters in the industry

title: Not really a good place to work
text: Pros Genpact has acquired Headstrong, so if you are part of headstrong you're still ok. I can barely think of something good about this company. Cons Salary is way too less w.r.t. other companies even other similar service based companies. Hike is really negligible. getting the best possible rating also doesn't help. Hike is just once a year. HR Team works too closely to technology team. so if you know them personally you're ok, else do not expect hike. Follows BPO Culture, starting from time monitoring to seating arrangement. Only 15 paid holidays. Advice to Management Really need to change a lot of stuff starting from salaries, Policies. Genpact is sinking and is taking Headstrong as well with it.

title: Best Company to start your Career
text: Pros Genpact is really one of the best to work all because of it's values and culture. Along with it helps and focus on personal development by providing best training for our career and personal growth. I will definitely recommend folks to start with Genpact. Cons Though Genpact do have some downsides as all other companies have, I think 1st and last is Salary which is of-course a big thing and important factor for living hood however if you want to learn and develop this factor can be ignored to some extent. Advice to Management From my experience with Genpact my only "Advice to Management" is to have better, clear and structured way of promotions (next level in the organization). According to Genpact policies a person gets eligible for his next level in the organization after full-time working with the organization however many a times seen that things are not schedule are not done at time and takes long to complete the whole procedure.

They way how they are working towards clients as well as employees it can give an high decorum area in the BPM world. Business is not only means to earn it also generate some social responsibility revolution. Genpact have the compatability can take an organisation up to sky high level. title: Genpact Headstrong CMITS
text: Pros If you are willing to increase your limits, you get pushed to the limits here because you have to slog. If you get into any good project(you never know unless you get in), learning could be more. If you know how to unburden yourself, delegate work to others, good in politics, or buttering management, this place is certainly a fit for you to grow. If you are really that good and have lots of patience, you might get onsite (if your stars are aligned & luck is with you). Have not seen much racism or partiality. Cons If someone does not prove to be good employee (work ethics wise or technically challenged or lazy), as a team leader or manager - you will face difficulties. No Bench concept - you dont get people any time soon; by the time you get a resource, you would have managed to complete the task with one less person, Salary for creamy people, good techies is less. Read the sarcasm in Pros section. Advice to Management Management has literally no domain or technical knowledge to look upto. They just know how to delegate their work. or steal others' work & showcase as their own. And, for that they should recognize the ones who do NOT the ONES who get it done

title: The kind of evil corporation you see in movies
text: Pros If this is your first job and you are smart, you will learn a great deal about how big corporations work. You will have access to see the processes of big companies as they allow you to go in shadowing in other teams Cons You will be lied to from the beginning. I was an employee in the Romanian branch and the recruiting strategy is to promise big performance bonuses, but they continously cheat you out of these bonuses by setting standards that cannot be met or by changing the bonus criteria constantly. The salaries are not worth the volumes you have to handle and overtime is not paid. Management and HR lie to the employees or pretend that certain things are not happening. If you are a woman but you are not Indian you cannot reach above band 4 (middle management) because they are very sexist (of course they won't admit this but you will see very few women AVPs who aren't Indian). They basically have no respect for other cultures (national holidays are not taken into account, in Romania large companies give out Christmas bonuses - they don't). They don't even respect the paying customers - I was asked to lie to the customer so they could bill them for more associates than the team was made up of and when I said I wasn't comfortable with this I was told that "maybe they'll give my job to someone who is comfortable with such standard business practices" Advice to Management Stop trying to fool your employees and customers. You will go out of business if you don't start listening to their feedback
pros: If this is your first job and you are smart, you will learn a great deal about how big corporations work. You will have access to see the processes of big companies as they allow you to go in shadowing in other teams
cons: You will be lied to from the beginning.

title: Waste of time & Worst part/experience in my life
text: Pros Good profile, lot of things to learn " But loads of internal politics/conflicts " Cons ABCD concept will be used by the senior persons in the process.. A- Avoid B- Byepass C-Confuse D-Delay I.e., The seniors will not explain clearly about the process as well the roles will not be explained by immediate supervisor.. But at the end of the day need to perform... I screwed my life by joining in this firm, but realised one thing very clearly.. The problem is not with the name board of the firm, its about the people... Advice to Management Stop explaining during induction that persons those who do politics will be sent out after investigation blah blah blah... What if suppose, the manager is having a main role in that politics... My advice - The feedback should be taken from employee by the HR team and action must be taken against the personnel.. The managers are having an advantage for them, which is called as " Background Verification " 1. So please find a way to pull out that authority from the managers/superiors 2. Get the managers/superiors to a conference room and ask him/her questions as whats the reason i.e., why one of his team member left... Then analyse it from ex-employee secret feedback VS manager's feedback...

cons: ABCD concept will be used by the senior persons in the process..

title: Experience at Genpact Pvt Ltd
text: Pros Genpact is the best organization to kick off your carrier. Working in Genpact is a real pleasure just because of friendly and learning enviroment. Pepole who seeks to learn while they earn is a best place for them. Trainings that are provided in Genpact really helps the individual to transform into a professional. Before joining Genpact the individual is a raw material and later on he becomes a finished good and for this all credit goes to the trainings session and learnings imparted at Genpact. Cons The one and only cons in Genpact is their pay which is not as per market standards. This is the only reason which forces most of the individuals to step out after certain time period. If we keep this issues apart then certainly Genpact would be the best employer to work with, according to me. Advice to Management No advise to the management from business perspective as they are really good at it and also have been performing excellently right from the beginning. I would urge the Genpact management to take a stept towards the revision of their pay.

title: Pretty average company(Genpact Headstrong Capital Markets)
text: Pros 1:Good exposure to Capital Markets Domain. 2:Small company, hence chances of getting recognized with the higher management are more. 3:Can get a substantial hike while you are switching jobs to this company as they are always hiring people due to the high attrition rate . 4:Lots of employee engagement activities. Cons 1:Typical hike for appraisal in the range of 7-9 % 2:Very high attrition which affects the morale of existing employees. 3:Heavy attrition in the leadership level as well ( From the 2 years since I joined almost 75% of leaders/Mangers have left the company. 4:Very bad infrastructure and no employee friendly benefits like WFH,Cabs etc. 5:Very bad leave policy .No sick leave or casual leave(only 15 Paid leaves per year). 6:Very bad insurance policy. By default only covers the employee( Even your wife or parents are not covered) Advice to Management Bring in more employee friendly policies

D) End to end knowledge is not known even to your trainers. Advice to Management Before giving the work to employees, give them a certain level of training. Right now the training are available only on papers not on reality. While giving the training give them thorough knowledge of the work I.e. end to end knowledge.
pros: Good for freshers, growth opportunities are quite regular.
cons: A) Too much politics
advice: Before giving the work to employees, give them a certain level of training. Right now the training are available only on papers not on reality.

title: Worst Company in terms of managing their resources @ Noida office.Just FYI I am a senior resource with 6+ years of exp
text: Pros None so far.Been there for around 18 months,got to say that there are no positive takeaways from this company.Limited clients,no projects,and even the current clients are pulling out their names as the quality of work is poor.Left the company now to save my career,moved on. Cons Worst management.CMMI level 3: Genpact Headstrong.Shameless approach towards employees,only two or three clients,there are no major projects left,managers are bossy and they behave as if they themselves are employers,treat their employees unprofessionally, Nowadays the company have stick to firing employees using unethical means by threating employees to put down their resignations themselves due to lack of projects,old projects getting scrapped and new projects are not coming up.If employee does not comply then they would make false cases against the employees in terms of integrity issues and fire them citing misconduct. Think 100 times before joining this company specially their Noida office.You will be facing bossy management with literally no work at your disposal.Worst work culture. Advice to Management Do not hire people if you have literally no projects with you,you put new joiners with experience of more than 5 years on bench marring their skill set and even asking them to move into projects with skills they do not possess,thats weird and uncalled for,was asked to do work that was not pertaining to my skillset and they are shameless in their approach,although i did give in my consent to work for different skill set but they will literally try to destroy your career in every possible way.

title: Not a Company to build your career, at most a learning center.
text: Pros They train decently other than that I don't see any pros going in favour of them. Cons No Overtime payout and they ask for too much, will make you stay at work 24X7 if they could. No night shift allowance, honestly I expected NSA from Genpact when I joined, but they don't. They say it's policy to not demotivate a person who is working day shift. I though do my ears deceive me, you are demotivating a staff who is working night shift just because you feel that will demotivate someone working day shift. They would not follow Supreme Court's judgement on NSA. The HR says you can apply for IJPs once you complete a year, let's wake up and smell the coffee. You have to wait at least 18 months and you cannot apply outside your department. So wait for another long period after completing the minimum waiting period. You think you are a hard worker, don't even think of joining Genpact. They will push you to the edge and then push you further. They make sure you work at least 12 hours a day and good part is its all free as there is no overtime if you forgot. Now you must be thinking you would not work overtime, too bad for you. They don't ask for your choice, it's a straight decision. You think it's bad enough, wait for the ultimate one. After putting in everything when you look at your salary you will start feeling suicidal. Like life is not worth living. Most of the good reviews that are posted that show today picture aren't true I feel. Trust me the list doesn't end here. Advice to Management This is just greed for success that's turning you into monsters. A company cannot grow if people are not happy.
pros: They train decently other than that I don't see any pros going in favour of them.
cons: No Overtime payout and they ask for too much, will make you stay at work 24X7 if they could.
advice: This is just greed for success that's turning you into monsters. A company cannot grow if people are not happy.

text: Pros If you're able to safely drive you car, you can take it to a convenient drive-in center. While you're there, an Allstate auto adjuster will prepare an estimate of damages, and in most cases, issue payment. Good Hands® Repair Network—Take your car to one of over 3,500 repair shops that participate in the Good Hands Repair Network. Allstate provides a written guarantee of repairs for as long as you own the vehicle. Choose your own provider—You always have the option to have your estimate and repairs made at the body or repair shop of your choice, and we will be happy to work with that shop.If you're able to safely drive you car, you can take it to a convenient drive-in center. While you're there, an Allstate auto adjuster will prepare an estimate of damages, and in most cases, issue payment. Good Hands® Repair Network—Take your car to one of over 3,500 repair shops that participate in the Good Hands Repair Network. Allstate provides a written guarantee of repairs for as long as you own the vehicle. Choose your own provider—You always have the option to have your estimate and repairs made at the body or repair shop of your choice, and we will be happy to work with that shop. Cons For some reason, most of the discussion focussed on the anonymity aspect. The invite to the suvey said it would be anonymous, the survey was hosted on an external site and we don't use any intranet, the handful invites I checked all pointed to the same URL. That's what I meant with "I think the survey is actually anonymous" - I saw no straightforward way to de-anonymize the results down to the level of a person. We received the invite to the survey with very little time till deadline, I think most of the answers and discussion happened after. That's why I didn't adjust the question, since it wouldnt be useful to my specific situation anyway but would disrupt the lively discussion happening. What I did: I was pretty honest and mentioned negative points, about the same as I told my boss in our last one-on-one. My boss asked me (to late) to be positive: The company was in a difficult situation, he feared that negative voices on the survey would give upper management the idea that all is hopeless and they should cut further losses. This is a small (100 people) company distributed on four continents, nobody knows what's actually going on. When asking this question I was thinking about these political ramifications (but wasn't posting enough info on the company maybe) & and wha upper management likely does with the survey data. In the team with my boss, we were also discussing the actual anonymity and how things like timezones, speech idiosyncracies (English is a second language to all of us in this office) etc. might give upper management a clear idea who wrote what. I left the company a few months later, till then I had not heard back from the survey. Advice to Management management advice good
pros: If you're able to safely drive you car, you can take it to a convenient drive-in center. While you're there, an Allstate auto adjuster will prepare an estimate of damages, and in most cases, issue payment.
cons: For some reason, most of the discussion focussed on the anonymity aspect. The invite to the suvey said it would be anonymous, the survey was hosted on an external site and we don't use any intranet, the handful invites I checked all pointed to the same URL. That's what I meant with "I think the survey is actually anonymous" - I saw no straightforward way to de-anonymize the results down to the level of a person.
advice: management advice good

title: A brilliant company.
text: Pros Naturally, the level of appreciation you have for diversity impacts whether you view a diverse workforce as a plus or minus. But multinational environments typically give you a broader experience working with people from different racial and ethnic backgrounds, especially if you travel or work with colleagues in different parts of the world. You get a chance to learn different cultures and different perspectives as you experience diversity over time. Cons Many employees in a global company have professional peers and even departmental colleagues based in different countries. Marketing professionals might collaborate with peers in each country, for instance. This setup can increase the propensity for interpersonal and team conflicts. Conversations and collaboration often take place through technology, which can slow the pace of interaction and lead to contextual misunderstandings in communication. You might have to wait to get response or feedback on a global marketing campaign. Advice to Management The value to relationship and flexibility be given over the much coveted time orientation.It will lead to better results and organizational culture should be reviewed time to time to implement effective culture building systems.

title: Great place to learn
text: Pros 1) Great place to learn - people have patience to train freshers who eventually get up-skilled nicely and contribute immensely to the team and company. Only one disclaimer: freshers are expected to put serious efforts to learn, else nothing much is going to be achieved for both sides 2) Great work-life balance 3) There is a lot of flexibility at work - work from home etc. is great, but frankly should be used judiciously as one learns and grows better if he attends office 4) Mostly young and fun people to work with 5) You get to learn multiple things, your breadth of knowledge really improves working here. The reason being the team structures are not too rigid. One can work on a particular thing in a larger team and also can get opportunity to work on other facets of work which the larger team does, if the person is interested. Another reason this aspect of career improvement gets facilitated is because generally people can take an hour or two from their regular work day and learn and discuss stuff from other team members 6) You can give honest feedback to HR, senior management about your reporting manager if things are unfair. Obviously, things may get leaked and people may not like it. But you would not be penalized if your case is genuine. I have come across some instances where such things happened and feedback was given to the manager. The manager would have been pissed off but made serious efforts to improve. All this reflects very well on the cultural maturity of this organization. Cons 1) Pay is not great compared to peers which lead to attrition 2) Politics does happen, but I guess that's common to most of the workplaces. But definitely a negative thing Advice to Management Have to quickly understand the realities of the market. Freshers and junior members' contribution are very important to the continued success of this organization. Try to retain them by paying them comparable salaries and thus giving them a chance to stay longer and pay you back in a much more meaningful way. You are growing a seedling into a plant and let them become a tree at your own yard. I understand it works for you as you replace the pool of leaving employees with fresh graduates and overall the cost remains low. But I guess you can have much better level of customer delivery if you don't let the good talent good away. You cannot have similar pay structures across all teams under Analytics vertical.
pros: 1) Great place to learn - people have patience to train freshers who eventually get up-skilled nicely and contribute immensely to the team and company. Only one disclaimer: freshers are expected to put serious efforts to learn, else nothing much is going to be achieved for both sides
cons: 1) Pay is not great compared to peers which lead to attrition
advice: Have to quickly understand the realities of the market. Freshers and junior members' contribution are very important to the continued success of this organization. Try to retain them by paying them comparable salaries and thus giving them a chance to stay longer and pay you back in a much more meaningful way. You are growing a seedling into a plant and let them become a tree at your own yard. I understand it works for you as you replace the pool of leaving employees with fresh graduates and overall the cost remains low. But I guess you can have much better level of customer delivery if you don't let the good talent good away.

title: Lead Consultant
text: Pros Learning and Skill development initiatives Cons Don't have stable system for retaining employees in projects. If you are selected for a project , you will have to prove your credibility to the client as if you are on Probation for that client in the organisation.. in short no security and career stability.. It takes time for you to understand a product dive deep into a role and by the time you actually understand your roles and responsibilities and work towards delivering your Best , YOU ARE THROWN OUT ! I will not recommend this type of work environment to anyone ! Advice to Management Please improve on the ways to deal with Employees , No Business can sustain unless you have policies to deal with clients who expect an ocean of talent from an employee and can give no respect and security to the candidate working for them
pros: Learning and Skill development initiatives
cons: Don't have stable system for retaining employees in projects. I will not recommend this type of work environment to anyone !
