title: Good Organization
text: Pros Transparency: you can contact any person for issue from bottom to top easily. Learning: ask your boss to undergo trainings other than you core job. Eg: lean training, presentation skills, green belt, quality sessions, time management, goal setting, Advance excel & much more. Education@work: enroll for professional courses like CFA, Mba & much more etc. But you have to sign up a bond. Wide business & verticals: Genpact is full of opportunities for every minimum qualification. Learn work & move through IJP to different departments & verticals like BFSI, BFS, CPGA & many more. Job security: As Genpact is full of outsourcing business, you don't have to worry about loosing it in future. opportunities are always there. Promotions: Very easy if you don't get involved with negative people. Complete your trainings, be regular, keep good ratings, be motivated. Off the job trainings: if you wish to learn & get exposed directly with clients, Genpact is the right Co. But only when you get new line of business.  Friendly environment: People are friendly, dress code is casual everyday. Many branches: Genpact has 4 branches in Gurgaon. Silokhera, 22AB, Tikri & Phase 5. 1 in Delhi which is DITP, & 1 in Noida. You can join accordingly. Cons Low pay scale: Genpact is always after cost-cutting. They don't even keep disposable glass for drinking water, no stationery. Lol Poor transport: In Gurgaon branches, cabs are usually late. But Noida is better. Poor management: You can find Assistant managers & Sr. Mgrs everywhere in Genpact, AVPs are common. & none of them can motivate you about career. Most Managers are self centred. They treat Band 5A population like slaves. Band 4 enjoys the team fund & do parties & misuse corporate cards. If you complaint they will ask you to have IJP, spoil your ratings, senior will irritate you everyday, give you unnessary work. Work load: Band 5 population is usually pissed off in department where quantative work is done. Night shift sucks & late cabs will make worst. No work & life balance. Mgrs will ask you to do work instead of enrolled training. Associates working in grave yard shift cannot attend training in day shift, impossible ! Managers are deaf they don't understand. No growth in BFSI, only CPGA is growing. You will become process developer in CPGA withing 18 months. But may take 3 yrs in BFSI or more. No basic facilities: I worked as a associate for 3 yrs, I did't even get my ESIC card. HR don't care, they laugh when you ask for ESIC card. I spend thousands on my treatment which can be done free of cost if I had ESIC card. Advice to Management Managers are promoted very easily. After stepping into Band 4, people keep getting promotion year after year. But role is same. Please make a action plan like introducing written subjective exams. I bet most managers will fail. Increase pay scale.
pros: Transparency: you can contact any person for issue from bottom to top easily.
cons: Low pay scale: Genpact is always after cost-cutting. They don't even keep disposable glass for drinking water, no stationery. Lol
advice: Managers are promoted very easily. After stepping into Band 4, people keep getting promotion year after year. But role is same.

title: Worst company to work
text: Pros Training is good. Opportunity to go abroad(with peanut salary). Lot of courses are there. Cons Salary is the worst. No proper co. Policy Management is totally inefficient. HR is biased towards VP. No night shift allowance. No overtime. No employee benefits. No work life balance. No recognition. Increment is less. Falsely claims to have GE values. Quality of people hired are very low. Salary is never review as per market,its the same for the last 10 years. No change is scale. A fresher gets Rs.7000 in hand. There is a bonus of Rs. 4000 which has skabs and parameters. Increment is 8 %, irrespective of the fact your salary is 7000 and its and increase of Rs.400 Genpact does not care if you leave the org. There strategy is like if 10 people leaves they will hire 10 people again. That's why you can see hiring happening 24*7 365. Advice to Management Please stop exploiting employees and giving them peanuts. If possible sell the co. To a better organisation.

text: Pros Good soft skills training for employees. Promotes lean and six sigma approach. Literally makes sure an employee inculcates these skills. Supports Part time post graduation options. Appraisals are not great and the process is murky. Switching processes for new learning/growth withing company even after spending a fair amount of time in one process is a real test of patience. No kidding! Advice to Management Please improve salary structure and provide both ways cabs that are in good condition with A/C. These are two very important factors that would help reduce attrition in a 24*7 service providing MNC like yours.

title: Good organisation with tremendous learning curve only at initial stages
text: Pros . Great exposure to various disciplines during initial stages of your career . Tremendous work ethics having carried it over from GE Cons . Great learning curve during initial stages of employment, unfortunately its not sufficient for constant growth. Learning curve for employees transferred abroad on secondment or permanently is close to zero . Although process driven, there are too many middle men. There is lack of clarity about these processes for those who drive them . Zero communication/hand over between HR teams in various geographical locations leaving employees on secondment/permanent transfer on their own with an "outsider" feeling . Communication gap between Account Managers/Line Managers and employees Advice to Management A business/process should have Account Manager for every region and employees travelling on secondment or permanent transfers should report in to this account manager instead of a line manager sitting in India who doesn't understand employment policies/work culture of that country.

Super extra efforts cannot guarantee your growth on the right time even if you score T20. No benchmarking for the salary slab. Seniors talk very much about policies, many times they try to avoid your queries by using this "Policy" word. Advice to Management Motivation must reflect in good annual increments & right growth on role maturity!!!

Manager in Genpact is not worth Team leader in other companies. May be very little exaggeration but you will go crazy once you see by your self. I will never ever return back. Unfortunately i had to work here for 4 years. Dont get stuck!
advice: Grow-up and Give some respect to the people who are working for your Luxuries!

title: Flexible, Boundary-less organization
text: Pros Creative Environment Work beyond boundaries Flexible work timings Work from home for the needy Great place to groom yourselves for the next big thing in your career Great place to begin your career Lot of Emphasis on training and skill development Cons Like all other companies in the world, you are susceptible to politics (I mean at every level, so watch your back all the time) "Yes men" are preferred over talent Your hard work may go unnoticed at times Appraisal system is not transparent Talented people are considered liability and creates insecurity among the management, so do not expect promotion even if you have gone an extra mile than your colleagues. Average performers are preferred over talent (This is again because of misconception amongst the management that talented resources do not stay long term) Sometimes the company really functions like a public sector organisation (laid back attitude towards employees' concerns) Do not expect miracles here, groom yourself and get out. Ethically, it is not among the best. Rules are bent at times to retain employees or avenge them. I have personally witnessed threats of dire consequences to the employees who were quitting. Advice to Management Management must stop being insecure towards talented resources. At times it is necessary to retain talent, get over the notion that talented resources cannot be loyal to the company. This forces even a talented resource into an average performer. Encourage out of the box thinking and do not resort to tried and tested methods always.
pros: Creative Environment
cons: Like all other companies in the world, you are susceptible to politics (I mean at every level, so watch your back all the time)
advice: Management must stop being insecure towards talented resources. At times it is necessary to retain talent, get over the notion that talented resources cannot be loyal to the company. This forces even a talented resource into an average performer. Encourage out of the box thinking and do not resort to tried and tested methods always.

title: Good people to work with, got a free hand to improve, innovate, learn and bring new projects, but not rewarded as expec
text: Pros Mild work load, easy work from home options (especially married women, easily can wfh for over a year). Good training infrastructure. Encourage & reward innovations in efficiency with Lean certifications & improvements in processes with Six Sigma. Encourage learning & moving to different domains. Job Security: will train & absorb in other domain rather than firing. Overall, a relaxed university like atmosphere suitable for nerds & geeks and of course cunning people who come pick up skills and go elsewhere.. Cons Salary is the biggest dampener, to the extent that it affects the morale (only people who are very passionate to learn & happy to get exposure without caring about pay can be happy here, and yes, you can find such people here). Notice period: 90 DAYS!!! Totally unjustified... You can forget getting offers from other companies, unless you have a rare and valuable skill, and since the pay is so low they do not mind paying for 3 months of your notice period. Do not expect hikes completely based on your merit, more of a communal mindset here.

title: Your experience with the company depended on where you report into and your boss
text: Pros Great place to learn, although it is up to you to find and exploit learning opportunities. The company puts very little if any emphasis on development, do you have to focus on your career and push for training. Recently announced focus strategy had made things a lot clearer for staff, but the culture is not clear to where it needs to be, as they don't value people and their contributions, so mediocrity is embraced Cons Indian based culture - they want highly skilled professional people but they don't want to pay. Respect for people at any level is minimal, this had been a clash with the western world, as not everyone is Indian If you are not Indian, fitting into the culture and progressing in the company will be extremely difficult Advice to Management As a company that wishes to be a global company, you should evaluate your leadership composition. Also look at the values you promote within, written values are the set you sell, but there are other unspoken values you reward that go against everything you preach to the street

title: I worked in Industrial Analytics as a Operations Manager, handling a Team of 35+ reports
text: Pros Huge organisation - horizontally you can move anywhere, provided current position get defunct. People are friendly - you can make life long friends. Flexibility to work from anywhere as long as you are a good performer and your client is ok Learning and development - best in class training for employees in all domains, skill sets and management. Decent salary hike, compared to IT and BPO industry, though it's on percentage basis and standard across hierarchy so if you are really low on CTC you stand to lose out. Cons Highly political work environment, which is not an impediment to your growth if you are a good performer. Networking is key to survive, if you are one of them you can easily spend more than 10 years here without facing any heat. No collaboration at any level, people work in teams within a team and in a very secretive environment. Knowledge sharing outside your team is seen as a sin by your bosses and colleagues. No place for innovation, with people fighting against any change or new idea. Be ready to fall out among rank and files of organisation if you plan to push changes or ideas. Go ahead only if you have the go ahead from your boss. Voice of customer is final, even if it's illogical and does not make any sense, by the way in which company it is not? Advice to Management Nothing much, Genpact is very a good environment. Just keep up the spirit.
pros: Huge organisation - horizontally you can move anywhere, provided current position get defunct.
cons: Highly political work environment, which is not an impediment to your growth if you are a good performer.
advice: Nothing much, Genpact is very a good environment. Just keep up the spirit.

title: Review for Genpact India
text: Pros For freshers, it would be a good career to start with. And the good thing is in 2014, Genpact is concentrating on recruiting more freshers/entry level candidates and trying to reduce their higher management by giving one manager multiple teams. So in a way, its good for freshers out there. Cons Once you reach Mid level, its not a place to work with. Genpact is a BPO and job security is a big question mark. If process goes back, it would be a hard nut to crack. Having said that, losing a process takes lot of decision making but the funny thing is employees who have been working hard have to pay their careers by losing their jobs. Reaching to the top level is not easy anymore like it was some 5-6 years ago. Salary hike is another big big drawback and management is trying to get cheap labour. Advice to Management Concentrate on rewarding employees with atleast a decent hike.
pros: For freshers, it would be a good career to start with. And the good thing is in 2014, Genpact is concentrating on recruiting more freshers/entry level candidates and trying to reduce their higher management by giving one manager multiple teams. So in a way, its good for freshers out there.
cons: Once you reach Mid level, its not a place to work with. Genpact is a BPO and job security is a big question mark. If process goes back, it would be a hard nut to crack. Having said that, losing a process takes lot of decision making but the funny thing is employees who have been working hard have to pay their careers by losing their jobs.
advice: Concentrate on rewarding employees with atleast a decent hike.

Lengthy work hours (8 hrs working +1hr lunch+ 1-2 hrs conveyence)=10-12 hrs you dedicate to compny every day. 7. No independence day off in certain processes, no voting day off, no indian festival off ---- and if you go on leave they will issue you CAP (a step closure to termination). Advice to Management Please enculcate some decent PR Skills in your management -- because they are very low ----- Classism is all time high.
pros: 1. Good Training - but only if you have good understanding with your manager ---- you know what it means.
cons: 1. senior management has very low PR Skills.

text: Pros Good quality trainers. Work with play. Flexible business timings. Cons Very bad pay structure. Lack of professionalism. Lack of transparency. The pay is low but the Notice period is too big-3 months, much higher than the industry normal. Also, the documentation provided to employees are drafted in a way that it leaves a negative impression about the employee. The DIP certificate is also not provided, leaving very few documents with the employees to prove their Actual pay.

title: Pathetic company. Bought a good company Empower Research and spoiled it
text: Pros Work is challenging. Good learning. No such thing as a bench. Within a few months of joining itself you will learn a lot. Culture is also good and very open and flat Cons Genpact does not pay. AT ALL. No matter how good a person is. They try to exploit the employees pay wise. Every good or brilliant employee has quit or is quitting. Everyone from new joiners to managers talk about quitting at coffee or lunch. Work life balance in Genpact is generally supposed to be good but here there is no such thing. And then they pay is pathetic. Attrition is unbelievably high here, whether it is reported or not. Newcomers are worried seeing that every good or respected person is leaving. If the top people are saying horrible pay and work life balance and leaving, what hope is there for anyone else. Empower research is still talked about as a good company. It seems all this has happened after Genpact bought it Advice to Management Stop saying Genpact is not a great pay master so proudly. It just makes all the employees angry. You cannot say something like that unless you are a company that gives so many perks like Google or something. You have to change this miserly attitude. Cost cutting and lean is good, but no one wants to work for a company that pays so low that the employee feels exploited and robbed
pros: Work is challenging. Good learning. No such thing as a bench. Within a few months of joining itself you will learn a lot. Culture is also good and very open and flat
cons: Genpact does not pay. AT ALL. No matter how good a person is. They try to exploit the employees pay wise. Every good or brilliant employee has quit or is quitting. Everyone from new joiners to managers talk about quitting at coffee or lunch. Work life balance in Genpact is generally supposed to be good but here there is no such thing. And then they pay is pathetic. Attrition is unbelievably high here, whether it is reported or not. Newcomers are worried seeing that every good or respected person is leaving. If the top people are saying horrible pay and work life balance and leaving, what hope is there for anyone else.
advice: Stop saying Genpact is not a great pay master so proudly. It just makes all the employees angry. You cannot say something like that unless you are a company that gives so many perks like Google or something. You have to change this miserly attitude. Cost cutting and lean is good, but no one wants to work for a company that pays so low that the employee feels exploited and robbed

text: Pros 1.Easier to get into. 2.Concerned towards the safety and personal security of the employees. 3.Impressive client and customer data privacy measures. Cons 1.You'll have pay for the cab facility that is always late. Be prepared to induce 30 more minutes to your already stretched shifts. 2.Compensation and other benefits are literally the worst compared to any other BPO/KPO. You'll earn more if you start begging in front of railway stations or selling eggs! 3.Has a vast pool of unambitious yet proud-for-nothing people. 4.Sets the best example of legal slavery! Advice to Management 1.Please do what you should as managers to retain the employees. Saying good job once in a while won't kill you! 2.Motivation should be positive rather than negative. 3.People working under you are not your personal slaves. You shouldn't manipulate your position to 'exploit' them. None of them are a complete idiot :) 4.Practice what you preach!

title: Genpact Learning and Marcomm CoE...Pathetic!!
text: Pros You may find some good apples in the midst of rotten apples, colleagues that is. Cons Pathetic management, whatever is left of it. There is a lot of 'hierarchical' hypocrisy where most of the people look at your designation before even responding to you. Things are mismanaged and things are done on need basis. There is no attempt to align things. People don't care about you or your learning. For them everything is urgent - they do not care about you. Surprisingly, this is a degraded division in Genpact where you are a commodity. Advice to Management Grow a spine. Learn to value people. Put the right people in the right role. You cannot demand respect.
pros: You may find some good apples in the midst of rotten apples, colleagues that is.
cons: Pathetic management, whatever is left of it. There is a lot of 'hierarchical' hypocrisy where most of the people look at your designation before even responding to you. Surprisingly, this is a degraded division in Genpact where you are a commodity.
advice: Grow a spine. Learn to value people. Put the right people in the right role. You cannot demand respect.

title: Once upon a time 'a good place to work for'
text: Pros Having worked for about 10 years, I can proudly state that the company is a good place to start your career with, learn and get trained. I worked here for such long purely because I did not want to get out of my comfort zone. I always gave my best and even 2 months before my exit from the company I have been awarded the 'individual excellence' award. Cons When employees spend almost '10-12 hours' in office trying to work extra hard to get that growth and pay, it is worth taking a look at their profiles and moving them to next level, rather than to promote people who 'talk more, work less'. Give more importance to people who work hard and build them to be your leaders. The less I talk about smart working people and the importance company attaches to them the better for the people who are reading this review. Advice to Management Encourage growth and increase the salaries. Agreed, you do not want to and need not be the best pay masters, but people do not come there for social service, they come to work - so atleast try to match your packages to industry average..
pros: Having worked for about 10 years, I can proudly state that the company is a good place to start your career with, learn and get trained. I worked here for such long purely because I did not want to get out of my comfort zone. I always gave my best and even 2 months before my exit from the company I have been awarded the 'individual excellence' award.
cons: When employees spend almost '10-12 hours' in office trying to work extra hard to get that growth and pay, it is worth taking a look at their profiles and moving them to next level, rather than to promote people who 'talk more, work less'. Give more importance to people who work hard and build them to be your leaders. The less I talk about smart working people and the importance company attaches to them the better for the people who are reading this review.

title: Good company for fresher and senior leaders
text: Pros - Healthy environment at workplace, encourages merit, fun@work, foster learning and development of employee - Fair employment practices - You do not carry work to your home in most cases, hence better work-life balance Cons - Middle level management is sandwiched, lesser growth opportunities - Top leadership is just bothered about increasing short term revenue, which often has negative impact on customer and employees in the long run. - Root cause analysis for customer or employee satisfaction are all hogwash, the issues are merely addressed at surface level, no one wants to go deep. - Middle level management is out of sync with company's vision. Advice to Management - Practice what you preach...look beyond the cliche - The general challenges in today's corporate is that everybody wants to grow so they need to meet the numbers but no one is interested in understanding how these growth comes their way? How these numbers are achieved? What are the long-term repercussions? Everyone knows that their stay in the organization is temporarily, if they are growing fine if not then switch to others.
pros: - Healthy environment at workplace, encourages merit, fun@work, foster learning and development of employee
cons: - Middle level management is sandwiched, lesser growth opportunities
advice: - Practice what you preach...look beyond the cliche

title: Good organization for beginners; at senior levels need to be part of some camp to grow
text: Pros - organization is very customer centric - highly focused on processes & improvements - good emphasis on learning & development - provides opportunity to work across different functions & roles - has women friendly policies - longevity of service Cons - senior management has been virtually unchanged for more than a decade, which means that the organization continues to do more of the same & lacks any new thought leadership. - over the years GE's heritage of meritocracy has eroded & given way to favoritism - organization is quite inward looking - work gets very repetitive & boring after a few years in the organization - huge disparity in compensation at middle & senior levels; compensation depends on your ability to negotiate at the time of entry & your ability to negotiate with HR post entry. there's little evidence of any salary banding at different levels of responsibility Advice to Management - bring in some new blood at the senior level - start reconnecting with employees at the junior level - bring back the meritocratic culture
pros: - organization is very customer centric
cons: - senior management has been virtually unchanged for more than a decade, which means that the organization continues to do more of the same & lacks any new thought leadership.
advice: - bring in some new blood at the senior level

title: Information which May help your Carrier in Genpact - All the best (Specific to BPO and KPO Not IT)
text: Pros Note: The below is from my experience and opinion. Anyone not comfortable, ignore the review and read an other one. The Company is a pioneer BPO, Beware and dont be carried away, The Standard has been a steady decline, it had hit its bottom. Less work pressure, Well, the Pros could have been a lenghthy list, Say Training, employee welfare, however, one couldnt say all those. work stations are ergonomic - Thanks to GE (who build the uppal facility) All processes are easy and can be negotiated with in your 9 hours shift. Lots of dayshft processes - so worth giving a shot. Promotions - Similar to all the companies - politics and favoratism does exists Learning and educational cource offered @ genpact - Well honestly all the companies provide them, nothing significant. I Gotta rate them 2 Star rating instead of 1- as their business model still works with a below par pay structure (Gotta give it to the higher management for the strategies which they had come up with) - it works. Cons Training - almost Nil (Cost involved) Compensation - Way below industry standard Cab facility - Smartly designed (got to give it) coz it discorages employees to use cabs Ambience and comfort in office - A/C wouldnt work most time. (Lobbies it does work, not on the floor) Pray everyday a client visists (As A/C would work when Clients are around as they are humans and we are ?) Most of Middle management - are now below par compared to 5 years earlier ( why, they all moved to other companies) and hence a very mediocre standard and knowledge. "You get what you pay for" Team outings and other activities where cost is involved - Forget it Few companies would recruit you one level below Genpact Designation (be aware) The design of GE - GECIS and DNA of 6 Sigma has disappeared. Ask any one who joined post 2006, they would be oblivious to this. One of the cornerstones of Genpact "Integrity" is very questionable when comes to information transfer between Management and Customers.( This is sensitive and leagal - Cant explain ) Every silly operation procedure would take a Ticket, followed by 1 st level escalation, then a 2nd escalation. Nothing works as a profesional environment. If you are in middle managment - watchout.( it becomes annoying beyond a point ) ( In a while you get used to it, however, its a skill which you woulnd need elsewhere) HR is redefined - designation counts in everything. It used to be a forem where you can voice out and action was taken. now dont even dream. if you are an associate escalating a AM, AM wins. if you are an AM escalating about an M, then M wins. (AM- Assistant Manager, M - Manager) HYD- they have a new facility in pocharam, now thats a bit far for most folks, so watch out where you would be placed. (Its a highway and rediculous traffic - Few fatalities reported) - best advise is use the company bus from uppal. Get water bottles to office, apparently cups are very expensive to provide (this is where it reaches the heights of cost cutting) - or those who have been to US, know in US offices they dont have cups either, but a water dispenser from which you can direclty drink. That equipments costs. and hence .... you know what am going to say. New applicants - be patient with HR (They are under a tremendrous stress) coz they had to recruit almost 365 days. they come across to u very rude most times and pretty unprofessional. coz the attrition is really healthy. Cant really blame the First line HR. Pity. Finally - Before taking a carrier decision please talk to an employee who is atlest 4 years in the organisation and a close friend. Those who read reviews, please take a min and give your inputs aswell. It really does help. Thank you Advice to Management Its a shame, look back 6 years and follow what you used to do, would be an impeccable company to work for.
pros: Note: The below is from my experience and opinion. Anyone not comfortable, ignore the review and read an other one.
cons: Training - almost Nil (Cost involved)
advice: Its a shame, look back 6 years and follow what you used to do, would be an impeccable company to work for.

title: Good Work Environment, Low Skill Job - Not challenging enough
text: Pros Good Team, Good Fun, New things to learn and a brilliant Learning center with many employee training modules running all the time to enhance skills. Friendly employees - Approachable senior staff. Ok work Life balance. Cons Work is usually robotic - Not much of brain work. Monotonic nature in Analytics division - only Excel and SAS code running. Lot of time spent on minute data detail rectifications using up a lot of time due to needle in haystack nature of problem which creates stress. Advice to Management Empower the Managers to create more acceptable environments and targets for employees instead of slave driving. Allow for good work life balance.

title: A Company you should avoid
text: Pros If you work hard and want to work hard, this is a company to go for as if you take more work they will give you more work. I used that in my advantage and used that to get experience and learn lot of things in very less time. Cons Here are few: -> High level of politics. If you are not in good books of your manager > AVP > VPs, you are done, doesn't matter how smart you are or how useful and hard working you are. -> You are not allowed to confront or advise your manager (Not all but most of them), if you do you will be treated as resource with attitude. Always consent your manager, that will make your life easier. -> Your performance is not evaluated by your work rather it is evaluated by how is your friendship with HR and how softly you talk to them. -> Your personal life doesn't matter. All that matter here is client satisfaction. So if you can satisfy your customer and make them happy by spoiling your health and personal life, you will be worshiped...yes just worshiped, do not expect any promotion or salary raise. -> This is may be specific to their IT division, but resource manager gives no consideration on allocating resources to a project. If you are available and there is a opening you will be allocated doesn't matter if that is you area of expertise or not and then you will be expected to perform as an expert else you will be rated as 'D'. -> Horrible compensation structure. At same level, your colleague at same level or even with inferior skill set than you might be getting double than you. You need to bargain for everything with HR..especially when you are traveling for company work. Advice to Management -> Reduce bureaucracy and number of managers and heavy weight HR layer. -> Get leaders who are smart and intelligent rather than just filling up post of Managers and AVPs -> Improve compensation structure. Do not need to be best in market but pay enough which can make your resources valued and interested. -> Last but not least, recognize your work force..performing work force
pros: If you work hard and want to work hard, this is a company to go for as if you take more work they will give you more work. I used that in my advantage and used that to get experience and learn lot of things in very less time.
cons: Here are few:
advice: -> Reduce bureaucracy and number of managers and heavy weight HR layer.

title: Poor salaries and no employees benefits.
text: Pros Professional atmosphere at the company. Cons These are the downsides of working at Genpact : 1. Very poor salaries paid to process associates. The HR always try to settle employee for a less salary. 2. In the name of six sigma, employees are given bare minimum facilities. The employees have to pay for their food, snacks everything. Only water is free to drink in Genpact. Even small call centers provide free food, snacks and a lot more. 3. The employees have to pay for the transport on their own, again even small call centers give free pick up and drop facilities. 4. Even in the training period, the trainers did not even provide Notepads and pens from Genpact. We have to get them on our own. Advice to Management Kindly provide salary and employee benefits which is at par or better than your counter parts . So that the professionalism and company image which you recite at all times looks more real.
pros: Professional atmosphere at the company.
cons: These are the downsides of working at Genpact :
advice: Kindly provide salary and employee benefits which is at par or better than your counter parts .

title: Some good, some bad
text: Pros The flexibility afforded to employees is good. Job security seems to be a lot better than most companies in the sector. There is a friendly atmosphere present in the office for the most part, making it among the more healthy spirited work places around. Cons High attrition rates lead to frequent changes in team personnel. The pay scale is on the lower side. The work is high on volume in some cases, but not exactly the most challenging. High attrition makes it difficult for teams to continue working without becoming disjointed.
pros: The flexibility afforded to employees is good. Job security seems to be a lot better than most companies in the sector. There is a friendly atmosphere present in the office for the most part, making it among the more healthy spirited work places around.

title: Join only if you want to [Settle] in life...No more challenges...
text: Pros Company have own sets of policies and assumption that you have to follow and your past industry learning will not be considered...When you join Genpact your assumption about IT/Software will change. Quote: "Every 5th person is Asst. Manager, 10th person is Manager, 15th person is Sr. Manager, 25th person is AVP"-- GANG of Average people (like BA/BCOM/BSC/Undergraduates/Correspondence/Distance MBA’s/Droppers) who never thought to achieve such position in life are the citizen of Roman........ One important thing "You will find lot of people RE-JOIN Genpact the reason is very simple once you have a taste of "LAZINESS/ BIG DESIGNATIONS/ PAK-PAK-PAK" here, you can not survive in any other Software company outside..and hence you don’t have option other than to join back Genpact.....Believe me its true- check out with your known friends here... Pros 1) Good training school for undergraduates/droppers, art ,law, and commerce freshers (Non-Technical field) 2) Offices has good Ambiance, Logistics, Security,Cab facilities,Work from Home(For Women/Managers only), Child crunches etc 3) You will learn about Six Sigma/Lean concepts 4) Company’s tagline itself says "Maintain Leadership"- Managers get special care 5) Will make you "Jack of All Trade"- Learn multiple skills 6) You don’t have option other than to take "Ownership" of the assignment 7) Every 5th person is labeled as Asst Manager--You also have a good chance 8) Good opportunities for social work through Corporate Social Responsibilities(CSR) Cons Cons 1) Not a good place for Niche profiles, like Software/Engineering/Medical/CA etc... 2) You might waste 30% of your daily time(Even though you are at operation level not managerial) in Meetings/Follow-Up / Escalation/ Re-scheduling/ Planning on papers etc. 3) Client expect your complete 8 hrs in the project, but company wants you to spend some time on company specific "extra-curriculum" activities. 4) Sometime you will realize that you are in a Government offices and the team you are dealing needs to be "Logically bribed/followed-up/escalated" to get the things done 5) Will make you "Jack of All Trade"- Lack Specialization 6) Everything is done through helpdesk ticket, for example if your washroom doesn’t have tissue paper or Water is not available, Shared printer is out of paper or to start Projector in the Conference room. 7) No On-Bench strength--Hires resource when required 8) Genpact practices unethical ways to save Attrition- 3 month notice if a resource is billable, if not company will relieve you next day with a buy-out option(No standard policy in place, just opportunism) 9) 2 type of Official functions, One for ’Employee’ and another for ’Managers’ 10) You will be surprised that you need to pay money to renew your company ID Card 11) 90% of team member get some sort of award --Not a Justice to whom actually deserve its 12) There is a crowd of ass-kisers, they will finally proof that all your points above wrong. 13) Most managers believes in Gold-Plating not in the actual project work Advice to Management Think Practically.........to make a project successful.......no gold plating please\ Summary: Its good company for those who never thought in a dream also about working in such big building of IT/BPO company, its good for those who never thought of becoming Manager by simply not changing the company.
pros: Company have own sets of policies and assumption that you have to follow and your past industry learning will not be considered...When you join Genpact your assumption about IT/Software will change.
cons: Cons
advice: Think Practically.........to make a project successful.......no gold plating please\

title: Reasons to be part or not to be part of Genpact
text: Pros GE DNA Enough and more trainings. You can become a quality guru if you utilize the opportunities for study and network accordingly. Many business divisions of GE so more cross functional movements. Cons Sucky Pay. Slow Growth. Suckups get a better chance at growth. Focus on 'management' centric growth rather than technical growth. Genpact has never been able to come out of the BPO complex. Advice to Management Market Stndards are supposed to be just that 'standards' not 'substandards' when it comes to pay. So pay good performers accordingly. IT services has become a 'sick' business coz you never could retain some of the best people I ever worked with. Learn more from GE rather than just 'cost cutting' measures and position each business accordingly. A BPO and an IT Operations /Delivery and Infrastructure services are different entities. Treat them accordingly! Let people move in the area of choice. If you 'hold on' to employees...they LEAVE :)
pros: GE DNA
cons: Sucky Pay.

title: Confusion and fire fighting at its best.Nightmare for IT folks.Maybe good for BPO folks.
text: Pros The company transport system known as "Wheels".This was the only efficient efficient process.But I heard they have outsourced that completely to a vendor and they now pay Rs 1600 to employees who don't use that. Good for growth if you want to a low earning manager or AVP. Cons Lowest pay if you started out here or have been here too long.If you are joining with experience you need to bargain hard. There is no fixed salary structure and you may get your desired remuneration if the process is desperate to fill positions.Be rest assured that the folks who interview you would have no clue about the technology they talk about.Once you are in, any future hike is a mirage and is only based on the time spent and closeness to you manager and not on capabilities. Company promotes you instead of giving hikes.They take pride in the fact that they promote 1 employee a day on an average.There are too many managers and AVPs with low pay scales due to this policy. Company promotes BPO managers and appoints them in Technology processes screwing up any leadership and technology mentoring scope for the team members.The BPO managers call themselves techies based on the fact that they worked in a Outlook or desktop help desk which is considered very techie by BPO standards.You will crave for technology work but will find managers and AVPs in abundance. You will feel misplaced the moment you step in if you are a technology guy since the atmosphere is pure call center like or a B grade college canteen with youngsters (mostly call center folks) running around shouting and screaming. HR policies are mostly BPO centric which means no night shift , weekend or on call allowances. Company does not use basic IT components such as pager alerting for Technology folks who do on call and you need to be in front of your system (especially on weekend nights ) all the time looking for alerts. There is no attendance system in place and you are totally at the mercy of your manager to prove that you were indeed at work on a particular day.If you are close to your manager , you don't need to apply for any leaves taken at all in the leave tracking system. The managers don't have clue about technology since they were former BPO employees and provide no buffer between the client and the engineers.I had joined with an outside experience of around 5 years in a newly formed team and was surprised to find the manager's salary was less than most of the engineers in the team due to skewed HR remuneration policies. A team of 10 will have no less than 4 managers since the company wants to fit it the newly managers created by their "more promotion and less hike" policies.This may work out for the BPO folks well since you can find many 21 year old managers too in the company.This is due to the fact that they tie up with local Universities and hire folks from first year graduation on a 3 day work 3 day college program.This works out as cheap hiring and saves company costs. Employees are eligible for on site opportunities after 18 months of joining at a peanut remuneration of $30-40 a day since most of the call center crowd are dreamy eyed about the US. Six Sigma and Lean are some of the buzz words here used by folks to show off their non-existent capabilities. Work is mostly night shifts (without allowances) due to the US based clients so beware if you have a wife and kids at home.Your social life would go in for a full toss.If you happen to work day ( in case you are very lucky to get such a team ) you will find a deserted look in office since most of the teams work nights. On boarding is a nightmare and you be herded like cattle since the company has walk in practically every week for it BPO operations due to the high attrition rate. Tech folks aren't treated any different from BPO freshers. Advice to Management Stop doing technology work and focus on BPO.I guess that would make it a better company.
pros: The company transport system known as "Wheels".This was the only efficient efficient process.But I heard they have outsourced that completely to a vendor and they now pay Rs 1600 to employees who don't use that.
cons: Lowest pay if you started out here or have been here too long.If you are joining with experience you need to bargain hard.
advice: Stop doing technology work and focus on BPO.I guess that would make it a better company.

text: Pros Learning opportunity Flexible work hours although it does come in the way of 'perception management' Flexibility on choice of roles Cons Senior leaders do not have any respect for employees Very poor listening skills and too much self promotions at the cost of own direct reports too, amongst leadership All about ;who is saying something' versus '; what is being New employees find is very hard to break into the political circles Perception management destroys all credible work done Advice to Management Look at your leadership seriously and consider if they really are meant to be leaders. Good operations people do not necessarily make good leaders. Listen to people down the line whose voices are suppressed by power hungry leaders. Get external assessments done. Stop initiatives, drive few but important initiatives and not too many checklist one's used simply to give someone their moment of glory. Review performance management system - too much dependence on perceptions and views of people who should not be having a view on the employee - everyone cant have a view on everyone!

title: A 'sham'
text: Pros Flexibility (timings, work from home) Cons Very low compensation package, bureaucratic, leadership (VPs, SVPs) has no real leadership qualities, going overboard in the name of cost cutting (at the same time, CEO and leadership receive outrageous bonuses), non-transparent promotion and HR guidelines and policies, CEO tries to 'motivate' by bullying and rhetoric, etc. Recently HR has started parroting the talk of senior leadership, that Genpact is a good place to work because of "great training programs" and "we help you build careers", a distinct departure from their earlier talk of "we pay right" which isn't parroted anymore. The courses offered through the tie-up with IIMs are a farce, and for quite some time now, again in the name of cost cutting, many such programs are on hold. Six Sigma and Lean initiatives are laughable, and the quality of such projects is pathetic. BD people are always on "do or die" mode, and are programmed to answer in the positive to every demand that a new (prospective) client makes. Lower down the line, managers get burnt trying to fulfill impossible expectations and promises. All in all, totally pathetic company. Advice to Management Try to understand processes better and just not blindly impose deadlines and revenue targets
pros: Flexibility (timings, work from home)
cons: Very low compensation package, bureaucratic, leadership (VPs, SVPs) has no real leadership qualities, going overboard in the name of cost cutting (at the same time, CEO and leadership receive outrageous bonuses), non-transparent promotion and HR guidelines and policies, CEO tries to 'motivate' by bullying and rhetoric, etc.
advice: Try to understand processes better and just not blindly impose deadlines and revenue targets

title: Is Genpact the place to be?
text: Pros Flexibility in your day to day job as well as flexibility to move across functions and domains. Telecommuting and Work from Home are some of the initiatives that are being encouraged by the company. Also, given that Genpact is still new to the outside world after GE, there is an abundance of oppurtunities across the world waiting to be won. Cons Salary at the lower levels. Only the SLT are very well paid at Genpact. For folks who like Fancy titles, this is the place to be! I am one among 800 AVPs(Assistant Vice Presidents) and there are no less than 500 VPs!(in a company of 30000 employees)...so clearly this can be a good and a bad thing depending on how important a Job title is to you! Advice to Management Need to look at restructuring the compensation across levels and start honing on a few ideas that will change the way operate rather than throwing a fishing net out !!

title: Not an employee friendly organization
text: Pros I cannot give one good reson for working at Genpact. Simply it's not a great employer work for. There is not transperency all. Its suffering with high digree of Bureaucracy. Always employee is at the receiving end (excepts for salary hikes and benefits). If you are truthful to your self, then you can never enjoy working in Genpact. You will at least need 3 years for understanding this company. Forget about top managemnt, the only thing they care about is how much revenue they have earned. You can join if you do not have any other good option. That is the reason it could not grow as fast and as large as other Indian Outsourcing companies. Cons There is absolutely '0%' transperency. lots of bureaucracy, nepotism and redtepism. Basically it's suffering withh all ill effects of bureaucracy Advice to Management Need to bring reforms in HR Policies and Resourcing Policies. Be employee friendly. Increase transperency. Kill bureacracy (not in your mails, but in reality)

title: Geen match met west europa
text: Pros Basis faciliteiten, zoals telefoons, laptops zijn op zich goed geregeld. Daarbij moet wel aangetekend worden dat deze expliciet niet voor prive gebruik bedoeld zijn. Cons Afspraken worden slecht nagekomen, of later aangepast in het nadeel van de werknemer. Bij het berekenen van facturabele uren (belangrijk voor bonus en verlengingen) worden niet altijd alle uren meegerekend. Managers zijn overbelast en daardoor slecht aanspreekbaar. Loonstroken en jaaroverzichten worden door Genpact als vertrouwelijk gekwalificeerd en mogen dus volgens de regels van Genpact niet naar een prive emailadres verzonden worden. (Uitprinten is ook ongewenst.) Als de regels netjes worden toegepast, staat er op het versturen van dergelijke documenten naar een prive emailadres, ontslag. Carrieremogelijkheden zijn er zeker, maar daarvoor geld wel dat er aan veel regels moet worden voldaan. Carriere maken omdat je gewoon goed bent in wat je doet is erg lastig. Er wordt verwacht dat je 20 uur per dag, 6 dagen per week bereikbaar bent. Als je een mailtje hebt gemist dat tussen 20:00 en 06:00 is verstuurd, wordt daar toch vreemd naar gekeken. Het bedrijf is volledig ingericht op normen en waarden die gebaseerd zijn op de (indische) wortels van het bedrijf. Dat wringt best wel eens in een (west) europesche setting. Advice to Management Luister veel beter naar de medewerkers. Zeker bij de consultingtak werken er meer mensen "ondanks alles" bij Genpact. Gezien de klantenkring is dat erg jammer. Neem eens afstand en vraag je dan af of dit nu echt de manier is waarop je je werk wilt doen.
pros: Basis faciliteiten, zoals telefoons, laptops zijn op zich goed geregeld. Daarbij moet wel aangetekend worden dat deze expliciet niet voor prive gebruik bedoeld zijn.
cons: Afspraken worden slecht nagekomen, of later aangepast in het nadeel van de werknemer.
advice: Luister veel beter naar de medewerkers. Zeker bij de consultingtak werken er meer mensen "ondanks alles" bij Genpact. Gezien de klantenkring is dat erg jammer.
